start.text: Perhaps after these last 2000 years, I may finally see something entertaining...
We'll make this one entertaining, any objections?
War is hell. This is no war. I have seen it, accross the stars, you have not the capacity for war.
You must think yourself noble, battling with our hopes. I assure you, this is no such thing as nobility, dog of the domain.
You will pay for your immorality, dogs of war.

start_boss.text: What beautiful sights. We must preserve them.
Our strengths are innumerable, our victory guaranteed.

retreat.text: And when we return we shall with the strength of a thousand, of hundreds of thousands.
If our lives are ended this day, let it be known it was in the name of the eternal delegates of Duinn, may their empathy reign eternal.

need_help.text: I require assistance, if you please.
My ship is in an undesireable location.
These are the tactics of dogs.

pursuing.text: They think it possible to leave? Maybe today, but eventually you will be run down. And when you are, your death will be slow.
They wish to flee, how amusing.
I do not believe in cowardice, idiots should flee when pressed. It does not stop me from pursuing them.

running.text: This battle holds no contention, we should regroup.
I believe this is ample time to make a rearrangement of our forces.
You inebriate yourselves on the rush of battle, I have other matters to attend to.

hull_90.text: You appear to have breached my ship, how entertaining.
That individual on the gun that hit us? Hack their gunnery implants. I want them screaming.
I suppose it is a good time for this fetid battle to actually begin.

hull_50.text: You will not defeat us this day, nor any day, dog of the Domain. With or without my demise.
What persistent dogs, under the heel of the Domain. They should be freed.
My ship appears aesthetically damaged, for what it is worth.

hull_30.text: My ship is burning around me, but my men still man the controls, does your false empathy inspire such loyalty, dog of the Domain?
My life in service to empathy. Die, domain war-dog.
My ship's explosion will be a firework upon the stars. Far prettier than your existence, dog of the domain.

overload.text: My controls are in revolt, assistance may be neccessary.
My shields are faltering, though not without purchase.
The dogs of the Domain have rendered my ship shieldless. Protect my crew.
Mein sohn, nur mut... *Sounds of crew singing, undemoralised*.

death.text: I have already returned to my other vessel, my crew are in your hands.

victory.text: And such is another day in the Persean Sector.
Be certain to check the ships, we do not want any breakaways while we are salvaging.
Perhaps, should another thousand years pass, battles like these will not be neccessary.
The remaining stragglers have left in cloaked shuttles from their ships, how amusing. You there, fire on those shuttles.
And now, time to enjoy some semblance of life before the domain again. At least until the next conflict. I hope you do not mind.
It is pitiable that they hoped to live through this battle.
